title: Is the US also a British colony? - Quora

response.answer_text: It Used to be. Back then, there were only 13 colonies for the British Empire to contend with. But with overburdened taxes being levied, and a general clamp on freedoms, the colonists had had Enough. (At least a majority of them). Sooo…The Founding Fathers (an all White,Rich, ‘Old’ Men’s club-heheheh), Pledged those fortunes, lives and Sacred honor to start their Own country! They then wrote and signed the Declaration of Independence. July 4, 1776. Welll…Ol’ King George 3 wasn’t too happy about That little move, and decided to send even More British soldiers to ‘tamp down’ this ‘colonial rebellion’. We all got to ‘rockin’ and a rollin’ in a skirmish called the American Revolution-which the colonists-a bunch farmers, merchants and other ‘rabble’ fought in like it was The end of the world! And it was!’For England. Looks like even England’s enemy joined in: France sent Her ships to the colonies during the end of the war. King George and his minions gave up at That point, signed the peace and the good old US of A was Born. So Every July 4, we Americans celebrate Treason er, Independence Day!

The US has never been a British colony. There were a number of British colonies in the eastern part of the North American continent. Thirteen of them if memory serves me right. They chose to stop being British, to join together in common cause, and to become an independent country. Other parts of what we now call the United States of America were formerly colonies of other countries.
